item.description:
***UPDATE*** - Weather looks wet and rainy for Wednesday morning, so I'm changing this to Thursday morning. Please update your RSVP accordingly.***

It's super early - but I know there are other early bird hikers out there...

For those who are addicted to hiking and need a mid-week fix, join me for an invigorating early morning hike in the Fells. A friend of mine once said that the Fells look, feel and sound different in the early morning hours - once you experience it, you'll be hooked.  He's right!

What's the plan?

We're switching it up a bit to visit the other side of the Fells. We'll do an approx. 4 mile loop of the Rock Circuit Trail.  While the terrain is not nearly as challenging as the Whites, there are a few steep ascents to rocky outcrops that provide nice views of the surrounding area and we'll get a bit of elevation and do some climbing. We also plan to hike at a relatively fast pace - 3+mph - and hope to finish in about 1 hour 30 min. You don't need to be an experienced hiker to join, but you should have some reasonable level of aerobic fitness.  So you know what to expect - we're out to get exercise, not take a leisurely, relaxed stroll in the woods. 

Where will we meet?

We're meeting at Flynn Rink on Elm St/Woodland Rd - just past the round-about.  Please be on time - most of us have to get to work eventually and if we start late, we'll finish late and mess up our schedules. I'll leave the lot promptly at 5:35am. 

What should I bring?

Water (24 oz - 1 Liter), good hiking shoes/trail runners, bug spray

More Info:

Rain will cancel - I'll send out an email (with my cell phone number) to confirmed participants the night before the hike to confirm details.

You can find out more information about the Fells here: http://www.fells.org/visit/

And you can print out free maps here: http://www.fellsbiker.com/maps
item.name: Early Morning Hike at Middlesex Fells (Rock Circuit)
